projectPurpose: To provide a flexible and widely compatible performance optimization tool for Android devices by implementing Frame Aware Scheduling (FAS) in user space to intelligently adjust system resources based on real-time frame rendering needs.
mainFeatures: Optimizes performance based on frame rendering time
Configurable target frame rates per application
Multiple performance modes (powersave, balance, performance, fast)

alternatives.name: MIUI Game Turbo (Xiaomi's Game Mode)
mainFeatures: Frame rate stabilization (often includes FEAS on supported devices)

alternatives.name: Kernel Managers (e.g., Kernel Adiutor)
alternatives.license: Open Source (Varies, e.g., GPLv2 for Kernel Adiutor)

alternatives.name: Android OS Default Scheduling
mainFeatures: Dynamically adjusts CPU frequency (various governors like schedutil)

marketPositioning: fas-rs positions itself as a flexible and universally compatible user-space alternative to vendor-specific kernel-level frame-aware scheduling solutions like Xiaomi's FEAS. By operating in user space, it offers broader compatibility across different Android devices and kernels, appealing to users who desire fine-grained, customizable performance control for demanding applications, especially on devices lacking effective built-in optimizations.
